title: Simba Bhora stretch lead on Premier Soccer League log table
body_text:
By Sports Reporter
SHAMVA-based football side, Simba Bhora stretched their lead on top of the Castle Lager Premier Soccer League (PSL) after registering a 1-0 win over Bikita Minerals at Wadzanai Stadium.
Simba Bhora’s win was enabled by Walter Musona’s 32nd minute free kick, which saw him taking his tally to nine goals this season.
The “Go Buju Go Boys” are now on 50 points, four ahead of FC Platinum, who dropped points at Nyamhunga Stadium in Kariba after playing a 1-1 away draw to ZPC.
Although a draw saw them maintaining second position, the Norman Mapeza coached needs to quickly pick themselves up as the league is now heading towards the final stretch.
Elsewhere, Ngezi Platinum Stars redeemed themselves from their recent CAF Champions League preliminary round one exit with a 2-0 away win to Yadah Stars.
The defending champions have now gone for 13 games without tasting a defeat in the league and are now on 41 points with a game in hand.
At Luveve Stadium in Bulawayo, Bulawayo Chiefs were held to a 1-1 draw at home by Tel One while CAPS United played a 2-2 draw away draw to Green Fuel in Chisumbnje.
Matchday 25 Sunday Fixtures
Highlanders vs Herentals (Barbourfields)
Manica Diamonds vs Arenel Movers (Postponed)
Dynamos vs Chegutu Pirates (Rufaro Stadium)
Hwange vs Chicken Inn (Colliery Stadium).
